1991","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"apmassie"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Powerful","reviewBody":"I just saw this movie last night and wanted to take a few before saying anything on it. It is a very moving and powerful movie that shows the power of loss and love. All the main characters are seriously flawed and damaged people that because they come together (thanks to the angry Tyler) become better people and find their own reasons to truly live life (something none of them have done in years).

I thought the acting was very well done. Some i have heard complain about certain scenes but truthfully, if you have ever suffered any of the losses or pains that these people have, they would realize that the actions are spot on! 

I am wowed by the movie, stunned truly... I am also very glad that this movie was made, not as eye candy for Pattinson but rather to show his and others talent on such a touching, difficult, and painful subject. This would not have been made if it were not for the talent in this movie that pushed for it to be made, THANK YOU!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Exorcist: The Beginning
Egzorcysta: Początek
programme.desc:
Exorcist: The Beginning: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Stellan Skarsgård, Izabella Scorupco, James D'Arcy, Remy Sweeney. Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0204313/","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI0NzY1MzQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001745/","name":"Stellan Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0527643/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936537/","name":"William Wisher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139627/","name":"Caleb Carr"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3262429721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"datePublished":"2005-02-09","description":"Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith.","keywords":"lucifer morningstar character,supernatural horror,psychotronic film,cgi animal in live action title,movie flop","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0204313/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"unbrokenmetal"},"dateCreated":"2006-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Horror movie, but nothing more","reviewBody":"I watched Schrader's "Dominion" in the morning and Harlin's "Beginning" in the afternoon, hoping that watching them back to back would make a comparison easier than for most people who waited a year until the deleted version by Schrader was finally released. Renny Harlin used only a few minutes from the already existing footage, so "Beginning" really became a new movie. But unfortunately, the whole effort of re-shooting didn't make the movie better.

In Harlin's "remake", we get a smart young priest, straight from the Vatican (James D'Arcy) who has received all the information about the buried church in advance. In "Dominion", Gabriel Mann played an innocent priest who does not expect anything terrible, he just wants to start a school in the middle of Africa. The latter was the better screenplay idea in my opinion, because D'Arcy is such a cool "professional" that we don't really care about him, whereas Mann was a character the audience loves for his human feelings. Also there is more mystery in "Domionion" whereas "Beginning" once explained the whole background, and that was it - too easy.

"Beginning" has a lot more gory effects, swarms of ugly insects and its demon uses obscenities in same way Linda Blair did in the original "Exorcist" movie. This will probably entertain people who just want a horror movie and nothing else. Mind you, "Beginning" also has good photography, a few unforgettable moments like the battlefield at the beginning and good actors! But the release of the original version "Dominion" proved that the story has had more potential, Schrader worked more careful with the characters and their relationships and gave more food for thought. I voted 6/10 for "Beginning" and 8/10 for "Dominion"."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0204313/","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI0NzY1MzQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001745/","name":"Stellan Skarsgård","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067503/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0527643/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936537/","name":"William Wisher","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139627/","name":"Caleb Carr"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3262429721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","datePublished":"2005-02-09","description":"Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith.","keywords":"lucifer morningstar character,supernatural horror,psychotronic film,cgi animal in live action title,movie flop","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0204313/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"unbrokenmetal","dateCreated":"2006-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Horror movie, but nothing more","reviewBody":"I watched Schrader's "Dominion" in the morning and Harlin's "Beginning" in the afternoon, hoping that watching them back to back would make a comparison easier than for most people who waited a year until the deleted version by Schrader was finally released. Renny Harlin used only a few minutes from the already existing footage, so "Beginning" really became a new movie. But unfortunately, the whole effort of re-shooting didn't make the movie better.

In Harlin's "remake", we get a smart young priest, straight from the Vatican (James D'Arcy) who has received all the information about the buried church in advance. In "Dominion", Gabriel Mann played an innocent priest who does not expect anything terrible, he just wants to start a school in the middle of Africa. The latter was the better screenplay idea in my opinion, because D'Arcy is such a cool "professional" that we don't really care about him, whereas Mann was a character the audience loves for his human feelings. Also there is more mystery in "Domionion" whereas "Beginning" once explained the whole background, and that was it - too easy.

"Beginning" has a lot more gory effects, swarms of ugly insects and its demon uses obscenities in same way Linda Blair did in the original "Exorcist" movie. This will probably entertain people who just want a horror movie and nothing else. Mind you, "Beginning" also has good photography, a few unforgettable moments like the battlefield at the beginning and good actors! But the release of the original version "Dominion" proved that the story has had more potential, Schrader worked more careful with the characters and their relationships and gave more food for thought. I voted 6/10 for "Beginning" and 8/10 for "Dominion".","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

cinematographer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3975510/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cul-952-852929"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A beautiful but a bit sad story","reviewBody":"This is a slow but very beautiful movie. If you only are in to action then this is nothing for you. But if you like movies that will challenge and dare your mind and if you not are afraid of something more deep than a couple of men punching each other, then this is a film for you.

The film will get you in a state of mind that will begin to think, to wonder. Will this be possible? Can a father be like that? Loving and still so demanding and ... cruel. 

And then you realize that it's the way people, mostly men, dictates their women and children to live exactly as they want them to do. It also shows how hard it is to break free from a family bond. Hard even if you don't want to be a part of it, if you do want to go. You can't go, there is too much holding you back. Fear, love, obedience even respect holds you back from leaving although you don't want to be there. 

You know what you have but you don't know what you will get.

For me the film was not about their ability to "jump". It was about the fear of something new, something you don't understand, the will to have everything as it always have been. Their ability was just the unknown in the world. The film for me was also about breaking free and leaving old habits behind, leaving (killing) the tyranny, the dictatorship and seeking the freedom.

I liked the film and I will remember it a long time - maybe see it again in a month or two.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1792,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

1991","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"apmassie"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Powerful","reviewBody":"I just saw this movie last night and wanted to take a few before saying anything on it. It is a very moving and powerful movie that shows the power of loss and love. All the main characters are seriously flawed and damaged people that because they come together (thanks to the angry Tyler) become better people and find their own reasons to truly live life (something none of them have done in years).

I thought the acting was very well done. Some i have heard complain about certain scenes but truthfully, if you have ever suffered any of the losses or pains that these people have, they would realize that the actions are spot on! 

I am wowed by the movie, stunned truly... I am also very glad that this movie was made, not as eye candy for Pattinson but rather to show his and others talent on such a touching, difficult, and painful subject. This would not have been made if it were not for the talent in this movie that pushed for it to be made, THANK YOU!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Loophole
Słaby punkt
programme.desc: Loophole: Directed by John Quested. With Albert Finney, Martin Sheen, Susannah York, Colin Blakely. When architect Stephen Booker loses his partnership, he finds jobs hard to come by, and with money in short supply, he unwittingly becomes involved in a daring scheme to rob one of London's biggest bank vaults." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0081073/","name":"Loophole","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQ2YmQ5NjEtYmFlNy00OGE4LTg4Y2MtNWVlOTM4N2MyYWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDYzNTI2ODc@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Crime","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001215/","name":"Albert Finney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000640/","name":"Martin Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0948772/","name":"Susannah York"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0703361/","name":"John Quested"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355054/","name":"Jonathan Hales"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8941411/","name":"Robert Pollock"}],"datePublished":"1981-03-13","description":"When architect Stephen Booker loses his partnership, he finds jobs hard to come by, and with money in short supply, he unwittingly becomes involved in a daring scheme to rob one of London's biggest bank vaults.","keywords":"vault,bank,architect,recruiting,heist","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0081073/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"udar55"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very few risks in this heist film","reviewBody":"Thief Mike Daniels (Albert Finney) plans to break into the biggest bank in England for one last haul. His team sets up a false office in order to interview architects with the idea they can coax the suitable candidate into mapping out their underground digging job. Down-on-his-luck American Stephen Booker (Martin Sheen) seems to be the ideal candidate for the job, but he scoffs at the idea of being a criminal. That is until he finds out his wife (Susannah York) reallllly wants to start up her interior decorating business. OH NOES! So he descends (literally) into a life of crime in order to finance her dream. The "loophole" of the title refers to the fact they will break into the vault through the ground and set off a motion detector, but when the cops arrive they will see no one inside the bank and think it is glitch. I'm a sucker for bank heist pictures for some reason and this one definitely falls into that category. Unfortunately, while it has a great cast and is well made, it really takes no risks. There is some tension in the final third as rain starts to flood the sewer system and the men must rush to get out, but even that is handled rather mundanely. Sheen also sticks out like a sore thumb and it is easy to believe the role was written for a British fellow (his wife is a Brit after all) and then changed to an American to increase potential markets. Still, it is worth a look at least once if you loves you some men digging in confined spaces.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Harvest
Krwawe żniwo
programme.desc:
The Harvest: Directed by David Marconi. With Miguel Ferrer, Leilani Sarelle, Henry Silva, Tony Denison. A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon finds himself involved in a 'body organ for profit' operation. Drugged, he has one of his own kidneys removed, and then, with a woman he isn't sure he can trust, he sets out to expose the ring... with quite a surprise ending for the viewer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107084/","name":"The Harvest","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYyZDBiM2ItZjYxMS00MmE5LWE2MTEtN2VmNDRkMzkzZWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001208/","name":"Miguel Ferrer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765048/","name":"Leilani Sarelle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798328/","name":"Henry Silva"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070272/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039851/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Harvest (1993)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4253876505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"1993-11-05","description":"A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon f","keywords":"knocked unconscious,male frontal nudity,male nudity,male pubic hair,based on urban legend","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andyroark"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quality proud B movie from the early 90s","reviewBody":"In this excellent unabashed B movie from 1993 you get to watch Miguel Ferrier and his wife turn one of the most enduring urban legends ever (guy wakes up in a bathtub of ice missing -insert body part- with instructions to call an ambulance) into a South of the Border escape covering topics from the Hollywood screen writing culture to Latin American police corruption to long term depression to child molestation to the underground gay community back to the Hollywood screen writing culture. What it lacks in production values (not much) it makes up for in heart.

This type of film was often showed on the off-brand pay movie channels in the early to mid 90s but usually centered more around the exposure of many, many nude body parts belonging to Shannon Tweed, Joan Severence or C. Thomas Howell (::shudder::). This film keeps its clothes on (and puts a dress on George Clooney, to boot) and delivers an enjoyable watching experience of pure escapist fantasy throughout which you will consistently thank God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around on the ground in pain) or curse God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around in the front seat of a Volkswagon with his insanely beautiful real life wife).

Good stuff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":605,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0282209/","name":"Darkness Falls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjcwOGM4ZDUtOGFiZS00YTAxLWExMTQtMWQ1NGU2NTZjYjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1015096/","name":"Chaney Kley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146536/","name":"Emma Caulfield Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1112328/","name":"Antony Burrows"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0509448/","name":"Jonathan Liebesman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364899/","name":"Joe Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004591/","name":"John Fasano"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888743/","name":"James Vanderbilt"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Darkness Falls","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3634364697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Sony Pictures"},"datePublished":"2003-05-21","description":"A vengeful spirit has taken the form of the Tooth Fairy to exact vengeance on the town that lynched her 150 years earlier. Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before.","keywords":"tooth fairy,darkness,night terrors,fear of the dark,supernatural horror","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0282209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"huggy_bear"},"dateCreated":"2003-05-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Come on, it's not THAT bad!!!","reviewBody":"Watched this flick late one saturday night, and I wasn't expecting a lot from this one. But I have to say, as I have watched plenty of so called "horror" films or "thrillers" over the years, this one actually pleasantly surprised me. Sure, the acting was not that good, the plot was, well, rediculous, but damn, this movie was a hell of a lot better than that yawner "One Hour Photo"!! This movie actually did scare me a few times. I got more than I expected from this one, and really don't see why it is getting slammed so bad for. Damn, relax people. Sure there wasn't any nudity or any slashing or gore, but if you really have to have blood and tits to enjoy a movie, you might want to check out the "Faces of Death" series there.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30541,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Exorcist: The Beginning
Egzorcysta: Początek
programme.desc:
Exorcist: The Beginning: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Stellan Skarsgård, Izabella Scorupco, James D'Arcy, Remy Sweeney. Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0204313/","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI0NzY1MzQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001745/","name":"Stellan Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0527643/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936537/","name":"William Wisher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139627/","name":"Caleb Carr"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3262429721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"datePublished":"2005-02-09","description":"Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith.","keywords":"lucifer morningstar character,supernatural horror,psychotronic film,cgi animal in live action title,movie flop","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0204313/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"unbrokenmetal"},"dateCreated":"2006-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Horror movie, but nothing more","reviewBody":"I watched Schrader's "Dominion" in the morning and Harlin's "Beginning" in the afternoon, hoping that watching them back to back would make a comparison easier than for most people who waited a year until the deleted version by Schrader was finally released. Renny Harlin used only a few minutes from the already existing footage, so "Beginning" really became a new movie. But unfortunately, the whole effort of re-shooting didn't make the movie better.

In Harlin's "remake", we get a smart young priest, straight from the Vatican (James D'Arcy) who has received all the information about the buried church in advance. In "Dominion", Gabriel Mann played an innocent priest who does not expect anything terrible, he just wants to start a school in the middle of Africa. The latter was the better screenplay idea in my opinion, because D'Arcy is such a cool "professional" that we don't really care about him, whereas Mann was a character the audience loves for his human feelings. Also there is more mystery in "Domionion" whereas "Beginning" once explained the whole background, and that was it - too easy.

"Beginning" has a lot more gory effects, swarms of ugly insects and its demon uses obscenities in same way Linda Blair did in the original "Exorcist" movie. This will probably entertain people who just want a horror movie and nothing else. Mind you, "Beginning" also has good photography, a few unforgettable moments like the battlefield at the beginning and good actors! But the release of the original version "Dominion" proved that the story has had more potential, Schrader worked more careful with the characters and their relationships and gave more food for thought. I voted 6/10 for "Beginning" and 8/10 for "Dominion"."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

Renny Harlin used only a few minutes from the already existing footage, so "Beginning" really became a new movie. But unfortunately, the whole effort of re-shooting didn't make the movie better.

past","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2660806/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fbcnova"},"dateCreated":"2013-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Two and a Half Women","reviewBody":"OK so it's not what you want you children to model themselves after but then neither was producer Chuck Lorre's Two and a Half Men. This is sort of the female version of that great show and maybe it's because it's a mostly female cast that it seems to raise the ire of so many. I don't know or care, to me its funny. Anna Faris is well Anna Faris and if you like her in things like the "Scary Movie" series then you will probably like her playing Christy who often innocently deadpans her way through raunchy or absurd situations with great comedic sensibility. Allison Janney plays Christy's Mom Bonnie who is the counterpart to Charley Harper's slutty mom Evelyn. The show probably could use a "Berta" but it has enough good characters to develop into the same sort of comedic juggernaut Two and a Half Men was, given some good writing. Time will tell.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2}}</script><metacontent="

wife","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1375670/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"djsneakypeaky"},"dateCreated":"2010-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good enough","reviewBody":"If you see the cast featured in this movie and think wow, then you'll probably like it.

If you're not a fan of the comedians in this movie chances are you wont like it. I personally tend to like anything Adam Sandler is in and this is no exception. 

Kevin James is his usual goofy self, Chris Rock has done better movies but is still decent in this one. David Spade was average as the whiny singleton. Rob Schneider was okay and Madison Riley as the character of his daughter OMG! Smoking Hot!!! I definitely want to see more of her! I did feel quite old (i'm only 27) when I found out that she was only 20...

All the acting was up to scratch and there were several hilarious moments.

A feel good, funny, family film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":232420,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

If you're not a fan of the comedians in this movie chances are you wont like it. I personally tend to like anything Adam Sandler is in and this is no exception. 

Kevin James is his usual goofy self, Chris Rock has done better movies but is still decent in this one. David Spade was average as the whiny singleton. Rob Schneider was okay and Madison Riley as the character of his daughter OMG! Smoking Hot!!! I definitely want to see more of her! I did feel quite old (i'm only 27) when I found out that she was only 20...

All the acting was up to scratch and there were several hilarious moments.

A feel good, funny, family film.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":232420,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Reign Over Me
Zabić wspomnienia
programme.desc: Directed by Mike Binder. With Adam Sandler, Don Cheadle, Jada Pinkett Smith, Liv Tyler. A man who lost his family in the September 11 attack on New York City runs into his old college roommate. Rekindling the friendship is the one thing that appears able to help the man recover from his grief.

Cassie is on the run, desperately trying to save her younger brother.","keywords":"based on young adult novel,alien,male objectification,invasion,kiss","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2304933/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"quothage"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"When I were a lad..","reviewBody":"We had The Breakfast Club, Sixteen Candles, St Elmo's Fire, The Goonies to name but a few. Defining moments in movies, defining teenage angst, growing pains and young love and loves lost. Films that stand up today, not just for nostalgia's sake but because of solid acting, amazing characters and good stories.

I despair for the drivel that our millennial's have to endure today in the name of cinema. If you've grown up on good films through the years then you want to avoid The Fifth Wave. Encourage your young-lings to watch something else.

Chloe maybe a good actress, but she couldn't drag the film from the mire of this cliché driven plot line with shallow characters and an awfully banal story of an alien plot to take over the Earth in as seemingly clueless manner as possible.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":103080,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

enough","reviewBody":"If you see the cast featured in this movie and think wow, then you'll probably like it.

If you're not a fan of the comedians in this movie chances are you wont like it. I personally tend to like anything Adam Sandler is in and this is no exception. 

Kevin James is his usual goofy self, Chris Rock has done better movies but is still decent in this one. David Spade was average as the whiny singleton. Rob Schneider was okay and Madison Riley as the character of his daughter OMG! Smoking Hot!!! I definitely want to see more of her! I did feel quite old (i'm only 27) when I found out that she was only 20...

All the acting was up to scratch and there were several hilarious moments.

A feel good, funny, family film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":232420,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Godzilla
Godzilla
programme.desc:
Godzilla: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo, Hank Azaria. French nuclear tests irradiate an iguana into a giant monster that heads off to New York City. The American military must chase the monster across the city to stop it before it reproduces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120685/","name":"Godzilla","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjFlOTI2OGQtMzg0YS00ZGE4LTkwMjEtZDUzYThlOTU5YjQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000111/","name":"Matthew Broderick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000606/","name":"Jean Reno"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001623/","name":"Maria Pitillo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071034/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053780/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195567/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002041/","name":"Dean Devlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254645/","name":"Ted Elliott"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Godzilla (1998)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3970236697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5YmQ2MjEtNjVlMi00YTcxLWE4MTAtOTRmMDJhNjcwYTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5YmQ2MjEtNjVlMi00YTcxLWE4MTAtOTRmMDJhNjcwYTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pre, "May 20""},"datePublished":"1998-05-20","description":"French nuclear tests irradiate an iguana into a giant monster that heads off to New York City. The American military must chase the monster across the city to stop it before it reproduces.","keywords":"giant monster,iguana,military,giant footprint,running for your life","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120685/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xophianic"},"dateCreated":"2000-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The preview was better than this movie","reviewBody":"I remember sitting in the movie theaters when I first saw the preview in which a giant monster green foot crushed a T. Rex skeleton in a museum. It was a good preview, and I thought the movie would be just as good. I was wrong, the preview was better than the movie itself. The movie was boring, plotless, unfunny and annoying.

The acting is not very good. Aside from Inspector Gadget, I think this is the worst that Matthew Broderick has ever done. The plot was almost nonexistant, much like the original Godzilla movies. The monster Godzilla and its babies were ok, but nothing too spectacular. I was hoping a few of the main cast would be eaten or fried or something, which didn't really happen.

Most of the jokes really didn't work, the story was boring, the characters were flat and annoying and the movie itself, although it had a few fair moments, was very dull. Your kids may enjoy it, though.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":186396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="
